含义: 仰 (yǎng) means 'to look up', 'to admire', 'to rely on', or 'to face upward'. It conveys a sense of respect, admiration, or dependence.
字形: The character '仰' is composed of two parts: the left radical '亻' (person) and the right component '卬' (which itself means 'to look up'). Together, they symbolize a person looking upward.
读音: The pronunciation of '仰' is 'yǎng' in Mandarin, with the third tone.
字源: The character '仰' originates from ancient Chinese pictographs. The radical '亻' represents a person, while '卬' depicts the action of looking upward. Over time, it evolved into its current form.
常用词组: 仰望 (yǎngwàng) - to look up at
仰卧 (yǎngwò) - to lie on one's back
成语: 仰人鼻息 (yǎng rén bí xī) - to depend on others for survival
仰不愧天 (yǎng bù kuì tiān) - to have a clear conscience
仰首伸眉 (yǎng shǒu shēn méi) - to hold one's head high
例句: 他仰望着星空，心中充满了对未来的憧憬。
她仰慕那位伟大的科学家，希望有朝一日能像他一样成功。
短故事: 从前，有一个年轻人总是仰望着高山，梦想着有一天能登上山顶。经过多年的努力，他终于实现了自己的梦想，站在山顶上仰望着更广阔的天空。
在古代，有一位诗人常常仰望着月亮，写下了许多动人的诗篇，表达了他对自然和人生的深刻思考。
诗词: 李白《静夜思》：'床前明月光，疑是地上霜。举头望明月，低头思故乡。' (The poet looks up at the moon and thinks of his hometown.)
杜甫《登高》：'无边落木萧萧下，不尽长江滚滚来。万里悲秋常作客，百年多病独登台。' (The poet looks up at the vast landscape, reflecting on life and time.)
